snippet: The vaccine can protect against cancer-causing strains of the virus, which is transmitted by intimate contact.
abstract: Pres Obama's Cancer Panel reports that not enough children in the United States are being vaccinated against the cancer-causing human papillomavirus.
lead_paragraph: The vaccine can protect against cancer-causing strains of the virus, which is transmitted by intimate contact.

headline.main: Report Says Not Enough Children Get HPV Vaccine
headline.print_headline: Vaccinations Against HPV Lag in Children, Report Says
